description: '''Jimmy Sabater''' (April 11, 1936 – February 8, 2012) was an American musician of Puerto Rican ancestry. A three-time winner of the [[Association of Latin Entertainment Critics|ACE Awards]], he was a singer and [[timbales]] player. He gained international fame thanks to his work with the Joe Cuba Sextet in the 1960s and '70s, and later became the lead singer of various groups including [[Charlie Palmieri]]'s Combo Gigante. His son, [[Jimmy Sabater Jr.]], is a trumpeter and bandleader.
